column1: #Text=[0325]The compound of Example 77 (3.08 g) was dissolved in THF (160 mL) in an argon atmosphere.
#Text=C., 1.00 mol/L lithium bistrimethylsilylamide/THF solution (18.0 mL) was added dropwise.
#Text=The resulting mixture was stirred for 3.5 hours as it was allowed to gradually warm to -30.degree.
#Text=Subsequently, methyl iodide (1.10 mL) was added dropwise at -78.degree.
#Text=C. and the mixture was stirred for another 6 hours as it was allowed to gradually warm to room temperature.
#Text=A saturated aqueous solution of ammonium chloride was then added and the mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate.
#Text=The organic layer was washed sequentially with water and saturated brine and dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate.
#Text=Evaporation of the solvent and subsequent purification by silica gel column chromatography (hexane:ethyl acetate=3:1) afforded the title compound as a yellow powder (1.37 g).
